trial_identification.studytitle: Home versus centre-based rehabilitation of older community dwelling fallers
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Domiciliary versus centre-based rehabilitation of older community dwellers: Randomised trial with economic evaluation

interventions.interventions: Centre-based service: Group balance, functional training, education and upper limb training interventions for 2 hours once per week for 8 weeks. 3 modules: 1.Warm-up of modified Tai Chi, workstations of balance and lower limb strengthening exercises. 2. Verbal education and discussion group covers topics of falls prevention, promoting physical activity, National Nutritional Guidelines, relaxation, stress management, future planning. 3. Upper limb strengthening and functional activities
interventions.comparator: Domiciliary service: Home visits by Community Rehabilitation Service (CRS) staff of 45-60mins duration, 1-2 per week for 8 weeks. Visits include 30-45 mins personalised exercises and education modules as for the group program. Patients from both groups will also receive a tailored home exercise program from the CRS physiotherapist.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Health Related Quality of Life measured using EuroQol
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured at 8 weeks and 6 month folow up.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Informed consent from patient directly or next of kin if patient previously demonstrated cognitive impairment (Mini-Mental State Examination score < 23 / 30).12. Availability of transportation to QEII hospital or Inala Community Health Centre sites.

trial_design.concealment: Sealed envelopes used to conceal allocation. After initial assessments have been taken and consent obtained, the next envelope is taken from a box. Inside is either "group" or "domiciliary".
trial_design.sequence: Sequence generated by random number generator using Microsoft Excel. Simple randomisation method - no restriction
